org.daisy.common.java

Class JarIsolatedClassLoader

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.ClassLoader
      • java.security.SecureClassLoader
        • java.net.URLClassLoader
          • org.daisy.common.java.JarIsolatedClassLoader
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Closeable, AutoCloseable 

    public abstract class JarIsolatedClassLoader
extends URLClassLoader
    Child-first delegating class loader that loads from JAR files embedded within the current JAR. Note that, unlike URLClassLoader, JarIsolatedClassLoader takes into account the "Class-Path" defined in the MANIFEST.MF file of JAR files.

    • Constructor Detail

      • JarIsolatedClassLoader

    • Method Detail

      • addCurrentJar

        protected void addCurrentJar()
        Add the current JAR file to the class path of this class loader. Or in other words, set up this class loader to load classes and resources located directly within the current JAR file. Calling this method is best to be avoided if possible, because it means that these classes and resources are also on the main class path, so it can not be guaranteed anymore that a class is not loaded by more than one class loader. (This is due to the fact that URLClassLoader uses parent-first delegation.)

      • addJarRecursively

        protected void addJarRecursively(String path)
        Add the JAR file at the specified path within the current JAR to the class path of this class loader. This is done in a recursive way: the MANIFEST.MF of the JAR file is read, and all the paths in "Class-Path" resolved relatively against path and then added to the class path with addJarRecursively(java.lang.String).

      • loadClass
